subject: Law
title: Autonomous Vehicles and Liability
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Autonomous Vehicles and Liability.

hook.text: A self-driving car hits a pedestrian. Who's at fault‚Äîthe car, the software company, or the person inside?

buildup.text: Autonomous vehicles challenge traditional liability rules, which assume a human driver made the decisions.

discovery.text: Product liability may shift blame to manufacturers. Negligence law may apply to software developers or operators.

twist.text: The trolley problem becomes real: should an AV swerve to save passengers but hit a bystander? Who programs that choice?

climax.text: No comprehensive federal AV law exists yet. States are passing their own rules in a patchwork approach.

punchline.text: Cars without drivers need laws without precedent. The law is playing catch-up.

quiz.question: What legal theory might apply when a self-driving car causes harm?
